ABS-CBN.article_headline: Remulla: Roque a 'non-entity' in Duterte's ICC case | ABS-CBN News
ABS-CBN.article_body: The Philippine justice secretary sees ex-Duterte spokesman Harry Roque as irrelevant in the case of his former boss at the ICC. Jesus Crispin Remulla says Roque should just return home and face the complaints against him instead of seeking asylum in the Netherlands. -ANC, The World Tonight, March 19, 2025 MANILA — Department of Public Works and Highways (DPWH) Secretary Vince Dizon on Wednesday formed a new technical working group (TWG) tasked to assess each flood control project before they are given funding and carried out in 2027. The panel, which met with Dizon at the DPWH, includes Department of Environment and Natural Resources (DENR) Undersecretary Carlos Primo David, who also heads the Water Resources Management Office, flood control systems expert Guillermo Tabios III, and Project NOAH (Nationwide Operational Assessment of Hazards) Executive Director Mahar Lagmay. “I’m asking this group to vet the plans. Walang papasok, under my watch, na (locally-funded) flood control project na hindi sasabihin ng group of experts na ‘to na, tama yan, okay yan, dapat gawin yan,” said Dizon. Dizon said this is to avoid a repeat of one of the more common problems he uncovered during his many onsite inspections since assuming office last month: the lack of any engineering plans. ADVERTISEMENT He believes this is one of the main reasons why flooding remains severe across many parts of the country, despite the government pouring billions into flood control. This also led President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. to order a temporary suspension of all locally funded flood control projects for 2026 until the DPWH addresses corruption and inefficiency within its ranks. “Marami tayong mga nakitang flood control, talagang hindi pinagplanuhan at pinag-isipan… Ginawa lang ‘tong mga flood control na ‘to, to be quite frank, para pagkakitaan ng pera. So yun ang kailangan magbago,” said Dizon. For 2027, Dizon wants the TWG’s help in planning the DPWH’s 2027 budget. “They will come up with an initial plan. Kasi right now we are still awaiting the 18 Major River System Master Plan that will be done by our international partner agencies like the World Bank, ADB (Asian Development Bank), and JICA (Japan International Cooperation Agency). Next year yan (lalabas), pero too late na yun kasi kailangan na nating magplano para sa 2027 budget starting now,” he said. ADVERTISEMENT Lagmay said by following a science-based approach, the DPWH’s flood control programs would become more effective, cost-efficient, and holistic. “Ang mga baha naman, hindi naman yan tumitigil sa administrative boundary ng munisipyo o city. So dapat yung assessment natin, pag-aaral natin coming from the mountains to the sea… Coordinated lahat— national pati local government units,” he said. The group will also recommend which existing flood control structures should be demolished if they are found to worsen flooding instead of preventing it. Engineer Tabios said he already presented some possible examples. “I’ve done some (studies) here in Metro Manila like Caloocan… By creating those coastal roadways, tapos hindi adequate yung drainage coming from inland, you create flooding inland. Hindi makalabas sa sea. That’s what happens if you don’t properly vet, evaluate the performance of whatever infrastructure na gagawin mo,” he said.

ABS-CBN.article_headline: Tigil-pasada ng Manibela tuloy sa kabila ng alok na dayalogo ng DOTR | ABS-CBN News
ABS-CBN.article_body: Ipinagpatuloy ng grupong Manibela ang ikalawang araw ng kanilang tigil pasada sa kabila ng paanyaya ng Department of Transportation na makipagdayalogo muna. Sabi ng grupo, posibleng umabot pa ng hanggang Biyernes ang kanilang protesta. Nagpapatrol, Andrea Taguines. TV Patrol, Martes, 25 Marso 2025 In a video posted Tuesday on his Facebook page, Barzaga accused the PCG of supposed "corruption" because it allegedly provided "high-ranking positions to undeserving public officials." He said the PCG was "escalating tensions" in the West Philippine Sea and called out its supposed interference with the China-Taiwan conflict. Barzaga claimed that there was "no future for the Philippines with the PCG holding power over our military" and said the agency "no longer serves the interest of the Filipino people." Tarriela, spokesperson for West Philippine Sea concerns, said Wednesday that Barzaga was seeking to "distort facts" and "disrespect the brave men and women of the PCG who risk their lives daily" defending the country's sovereignty. ADVERTISEMENT "As a member of @HouseofRepsPH, to call for the abolition of the PCG and dismiss our existence as a 'waste of government funds' is both reckless and deeply insulting to the 36,000 strong of the PCG who serve this nation with honor and courage," he said. "We urge the public to discern facts from fiction and to stand with those truly committed to the defense of our national interests," Tarriela said on X. He called Barzaga's World War 3 assertions "alarmist, inaccurate, and deeply irresponsible," noting that the West Philippine Sea issue was "not an abstract geopolitical issue—it is part of our national patrimony." "It encompasses vital fishing grounds, trade routes, and marine resources that sustain millions of Filipino families," he said. The PCG's presence in the West Philippine Sea, Tarriela said, "is not an act of provocation," explaining that its absence would mean "a blatant dereliction of duty." ADVERTISEMENT He said the PCG was mandated to uphold and protect the Philippines' sovereign rights under international law, including the United Nations Convention on the Law of the Sea and the 2016 arbitral ruling that rejected China's sweeping claims in the South China Sea. Tarriela rejected Barzaga's accusation that the PCG confers high positions on political figures, saying the honorary ranks are only symbolic and do not grant them authority. He said the politicians do not hold command positions and operational control over the PCG. The coast guard official noted that the PCG, while an armed and uniformed service, is not part of the Armed Forces of the Philippines but is an attached agency to the Department of Transportation. "To portray the PCG as a military is not only inaccurate—it undermines the principles upon which civilian maritime governance is built," he said. ADVERTISEMENT "Our men and women operate in the harshest conditions—rescuing those in distress at sea, enforcing maritime laws, protecting our environment, and standing firm against coercion in the WPS. Many have sacrificed their lives in the line of duty. To trivialize their service as wasteful betrays not only a lack of understanding but also a lack of empathy," Tarriela said.

ABS-CBN.article_headline: Comelec tells candidates to be wary of scam offering 'pre-shaded ballots' | ABS-CBN News
ABS-CBN.article_body: MANILA — The Commission on Elections on Wednesday said there is a scam targeting candidates which supposedly guarantees their victory in the polls through ballots that have already been secretly shaded. Comelec Chairman George Erwin Garcia said according to the scheme, the pre-shaded ballots would nullify votes for the opposing candidate. "Kasi tehnically dalawa ang shade - isang invisible shade saka yung shade na ginawa ng botante," Garcia said. According to Commissioner Nelson Celis, the Comelec has a security feature to safeguard the integrity of ballots, and the entire election process. ADVERTISEMENT "Meron kaming bagong security feature na ginawa dito sa Comelec. Meron kaming hybridized system. Ibig sabihin, pagkatapos ng counting ng makina, yung 14 inch monitor, idi-display lahat balota na scanned. Ibig sabihin, pwede kunan ng picture at video, pwede manual counting. Mahirap madaya ang election because of this hybridized counting natin," Celis explained. Commissioner Aimee Ferolino reminded candidates not to patronize this kind of offer saying there is no such thing as "sure win" in any election. "Sana wala ng ibang ma-convince ang mga taong ito. No such thing as added layer of assurance for a candidate to win. Nasa tao nakasalalay kung manalo o matalo," according to Ferolino. Comelec reminded all candidates to use biodegradable materials in their campaign posters. Garcia explained, aside from cloth, and paper, there are tarpaulins that use biodegradable materials. “Kapag ang tarpaulin gawa sa pure plastic hindi natin papayagan yan sapagkat yan ay non-biodegradable materials. Pero ngayon may mga tarpaulin na gawa sa plastic pero biodegradable - yun pupuwedeng ingredients sa paggawa ng mga tarpaulin natin” Garcia explained. ADVERTISEMENT The commission according to Garcia will no longer conduct “Oplan Baklas” and instead it will send written notices to candidates who will violate rules on campaign materials and common poster areas. Garcia said, violators will be given 3 days to remove their campaign materials posted illegally and if the candidate will not comply, the commission will then issue show cause order for them to explain. According to Garcia, based on monitoring, there are 5 senatorial candidates who continuously violate guidelines on proper posting of campaign paraphernalia. He however refused to name names. "Ayaw ko muna sabihin pero may listahan kami sa bawat regions ng violators. Naka-classify pa. Mga 5 ang senatorial candidates na talagang consistent sa bawat region ay may violations," Garcia said. Meantime, the two new Comelec commissioners joined their colleagues in the en banc session on Wednesday, February 12. Commissioner Noli Pipo, took his oath of office before Garcia. Commissioner Maria Norina Casingal was also present during the oath taking ceremony. ADVERTISEMENT According to Garcia, the decision of president Ferdinand Marcos Jr. to appoint Casingal and Pipo who are both insiders is a reflection of how the president valued the services of Comelec personnel. Commissioner Rey Bulay meanwhile appealed to the public not to immediately judge its new commissioners and let them prove their worth. “Sana po bigyan nyo kami ng tsansa sa choice na ito, bigyan nyo muna ng tsnang maprove yung worth ng dalawa naming bagong commisisoner. Ako po tataya ng piso tamang barko dun sa dalawa,” Bulay said.

ABS-CBN.article_headline: DOJ to defend gov't in SC case questioning Duterte arrest | ABS-CBN News
ABS-CBN.article_body: MANILA (UPDATE) — The Department of Justice (DOJ) is now the government's legal representative in the Supreme Court (SC) case questioning the arrest and transfer of former President Rodrigo Duterte to the custody of the International Criminal Court (ICC). Justice Secretary Jesus Crispin Remulla confirmed the DOJ has already submitted its comment on the petitions for habeas corpus filed by Davao City 1st District Rep. Paolo Duterte, Davao City Mayor Sebastian Duterte and Veronica Duterte. “We were given authorization by the Executive Secretary to, kami na ang sumagot, OK na, nabigay na namin ang comment namin kahapon,” Remulla said on Tuesday. This, after the Office of Solicitor General (OSG), the government's default lawyer, opted out of the case, citing conflict in previous positions. ADVERTISEMENT “Considering the OSG's firm position that the ICC is barred from exercising jurisdiction over the Philippines... the OSG may not be able to effectively represent Respondents in these cases and is constrained to recuse itself from participating herein,” Solicitor General Menardo Guevarra said in his motion filed Monday. Duterte was arrested Tuesday last week after the Interpol served the arrest warrant issued by the ICC. He was sent to The Hague, Netherlands on the same day. President Marcos said the Philippine government cooperated with the Interpol and not with the ICC in delivering Duterte to The Hague. Asked if it is still possible to ask the International Criminal Court to bring back Duterte to the Philippines, Remulla said that might not be possible. “Wala na iyon, tapos na iyon, it’s a done deal already,” he said. ADVERTISEMENT Remulla refused to divulge the details of the arguments they presented to the court. “Hayaan na natin, iyong dokumentong binigay namin sapat na iyon para sagutin ang mga sinabi nila sa korte,” Remulla said. Meantime, Remulla refused to comment on Guevarra’s recusal to represent the government before the Supreme Court. “I will not speak about the comment because it is with the court right now,” Remulla said. Former Senior Associate Justice Antonio Carpio said Marcos should consider firing Guevarra over his refusal to defend the government in the Duterte case.

ABS-CBN.article_headline: 3rd batch of Filipinos from Gaza arrives in PH | ABS-CBN News
ABS-CBN.article_body: MANILA (UPDATED) — The third batch of Filipino nationals from Gaza arrived at Ninoy Aquino International Airport Terminal 3 on Tuesday afternoon. This batch is composed of four families, including 14 Filipinos and their six Palestinian spouses. They were welcomed by officials from the Department of Foreign Affairs, Overseas Workers Welfare Association, Department of Social Welfare and Development, and the Department of Health. Ravelina Cargullo was among those who arrived. She shared how the deteriorating situation in Gaza led them to flee, saying, “Pag pinapasabog po kami sa gabi tumatakbo kaming mag-iina malapit sa wall para mag umpok-umpukan lang po.” Ravelina recounted the hardships she and her family faced due to the Israel-Hamas war, including the lack of water and electricity. “Wala kaming kuryente, wala po kaming tubig. Almost one month sumasandok lang kami sa ilalim ng bahay ng isang building na tinitirhan namin. Doon kami kumukuha,” she said. According to DFA Assistant Secretary Robert Ferrer, upon their arrival, the families went through debriefing sessions to address the trauma they experienced. “May crisis management ang DSWD dito so we have trained psychologists, trained people,” Asec. Ferrer said. Ferrer emphasized that those with families or relatives in the country will be permitted to come home, while those without will be presented with various options through a government program. “Those who have not any connection with the country like wala sila kamag-anak, we will connect them with their LGUs, with their relatives here,” he said. “'Yung wala, we have already informed DSWD and the other agencies about it and we are having an inter-agency process.” Ferrer admitted there are still Filipinos who opted to stay in Gaza despite the volatile situation. “Their own decision po 'yun but we are asking them to change their mind and go home na lang,” Ferrer said. ADVERTISEMENT As of Tuesday, there are a total of 89 Filipinos and their 14 Palestinian spouses who have returned home to the Philippines. A fourth batch of evacuees is expected to arrive Wednesday.

ABS-CBN.article_headline: Marcos Jr. thanks UAE for pardon of 115 Filipinos ahead of Eid Al-Adha | ABS-CBN News
ABS-CBN.article_body: MANILA — President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. has thanked the United Arab Emirates for issuing a pardon for 115 convicted Filipinos to mark this year’s Eid Al-Adha, saying that the gesture is a testament to the two countries’ “special partnership.” The president did not mention what crimes these Filipino convicts committed but noted that Emirati Ambassador to the Philippines Mohamed Obaid Alqataam Alzaabi personally relayed the good news. “This gesture is a reflection of our countries’ special partnership, as embodied in the nearly one million Filipinos who have made the Emirates their home and in the warm personal friendship and mutual respect between myself as the leader of the Emiratis,” Marcos Jr. said in a statement posted on Saturday. "[S]uch acts of kindness pave the way for continued cooperation and understanding in the years to come,” the President said. ADVERTISEMENT “On behalf of the Philippine government, we extend our sincerest thanks to President Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan for this compassionate act,” he added. The Philippine Embassy in the UAE and the Consulate General in Dubai on Saturday called the grant of royal clemency a “benevolent act, which further strengthens the longstanding bonds of friendship and cooperation” between the two countries. Last year, 143 Filipinos received a pardon for their crimes in the UAE in time for Eid Al-Adha, while 220 others were given the same reprieve to mark the Middle Eastern country’s national day. Of the 2.16 million registered overseas Filipino workers in 2023, 13.6 percent are based in the UAE, according to data from the Philippine Statistics Authority.

ABS-CBN.article_headline: Marcos Jr. to visit Vietnam next week | ABS-CBN News
ABS-CBN.article_body: President Marcos Jr. will make a two-day visit to Vietnam next week. He flies out Monday on his first official overseas trip this year. - The World Tonight, ANC, January 26, 2024 MANILA — Based on park management estimates, the number of visitors at Manila Memorial Park in Parañaque for October 31 alone is expected to hit 300,000. But for the entirety of the Undas season, this is seen to reach 800,000, according to Manila Memorial Park Assistant Manager Len Acosta. Around 50 police officers, as well as around nine volunteer groups, have also been deployed for visitors’ safety. These include the Philippine Red Cross and the Accredited Community Disaster Volunteers (ACDV). ADVERTISEMENT According to ACDV Team Leader Thomas Hallare, in previous years, they often saw mild medical cases such as bruising. “Mga normal cases lang. Mga nahilo, nadapa. Bruises lang. Pero pagka may mga major disaster or emergency na may victim na hindi kaya na gamutin dito sa aming unit, itinatawag namin sa base ng DRRMO,” Hallare said. Hallare added that they are ready to give emergency medical response, as well as aid in traffic management. Given the hot weather, Acosta advised visitors to bring fans, umbrellas, and water. “Reminder nalang po is ‘yung magdala po talaga ng pamaypay, payong, and water po kasi sa panahon po namin ngayon na sobrang init, medyo nakaka-dehydrate po talaga,” Acosta said. ADVERTISEMENT At least three items were also confiscated at the park by Friday, including a vape, a cigarette, and brass knuckles. Among prohibited items are lighters, knives, alcoholic drinks, guitars, playing cards, bluetooth speakers, gasoline, guns, and pets not wearing diapers. Acosta said the park discourages use of tents with faces and names printed on them, especially of political figures. The peak time for visitors is seen to begin on November 1, Saturday, at 4 p.m. Some of the influential figures laid to rest at the Manila Memorial Park include former presidents Cory Aquino and Benigno Aquino III, former senator Benigno Aquino Jr., celebrities Rico Yan and AJ Perez, and broadcaster Percy Lapid. ADVERTISEMENT As early as October 31st, flowers from President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. and the Manila local government could already be seen at the Aquino family’s tomb. Some visitors, such as Gigi Jintalan, make sure to pay their respects not only to their departed loved ones at the cemetery, but also figures such as the members of the Aquino family. “We really go out of the way and pass by… They were not only influential, but the principles that they stood for,” Jintalan said. Another visitor, Schuyler Garcia, advises people planning to come to the park in the following days to make early trips, especially as parking spots were already limited by October 31. “Come early, ‘cause you’re going to be finding a lot of people for parking. And considering the weather, it’s a bit unpredictable, bring tents,” Garcia said. ADVERTISEMENT The Manila Memorial Park in Parañaque is open for 24 hours until November 2. By November 3, it will close at 6 p.m.

ABS-CBN.article_headline: TV PATROL: PAF FA-50 at F-16 US fighter jets sasabak sa Cope Thunder 2025 | ABS-CBN News
ABS-CBN.article_body: Pormal nang sinimulan ang bilateral exercise ng Air Force ng Pilipinas at Amerika na Cope Thunder 2025. Nagpapatrol, Bianca Dava. TV Patrol, Lunes, 7 Abril 2025. KUALA LUMPUR — President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. stood firm that filing cases against those involved in the flood control fiasco cannot be done in haste, stressing that due process should be observed. This was in response to some business and labor groups who criticized him over supposed “slow” actions vs corruption into the flood control scandal. He said that he constantly gets messages telling him to order people allegedly involved arrested. “‘Alam naman natin kung sino sila, ikulong mo na.’ ‘Kunin mo lahat ang pera nila.’ ‘Ipagbenta mo na ‘yung mga bahay nila, ibalik sa ano…” ('We know who they are, just jail them'. 'Take all their money'. 'Sell their houses...') What would then I be accused of if we did that?’ Marcos Jr. said in a press briefing following the closing ceremony of the 47th ASEAN Summit and Related Summits Tuesday, October 28. ADVERTISEMENT Business groups noted over the weekend that months since Marcos Jr. called out flood control anomalies in his State of the Nation Address, they were “told to be content with immigration lookout bulletins for now” instead of hold-departure orders that are issued by courts. The chief executive argued that cases should be backed up by solid evidence to assure conviction. He said that people who have stolen billions from the government may end up being set free if weak cases are filed against them. “That would be much worse result. So, due process must be observed,” Marcos Jr. asked. “We must make sure na alam – alam naman talaga natin kung sino sila. Kaya tiyakin natin na makukulong talaga sila at ang kanilang mga ninakaw ay ibalik sa gobyerno, ibalik sa tao,” he added. ADVERTISEMENT (We must make sure — we really do know who they are. So let us make sure that they are convicted and what they stole will be returned to the government, to the people) He said the government only gets “one chance at this" and that government cannot waste the opportunity to bring corrupt officials and contractors to account. “So, do you want to get it done quickly or do you want to get it done right? That's the choice that we have,” he added.

ABS-CBN.article_headline: Sara Duterte barred from Villamor Air Base before dad Rodrigo's Hague flight, admits CIDG chief | ABS-CBN News
ABS-CBN.article_body: MANILA — The chief of the police Criminal Investigation and Detection Group admitted Thursday that he denied Vice President Sara Duterte entry into Villamor Air Base before her father, former President Rodrigo Duterte, was brought to The Hague this week. CIDG chief MGen. Nicolas Torre noted that the elder Duterte was already with his lawyers at that time. "Bakit kailangang dagdagan pa ang gulo?" said Torre, who acted as ground commander during Duterte's arrest. Torre headed the Davao regional police before serving as CIDG chief. He also led the two-week operation to arrest controversial religious leader Pastor Apollo Quiboloy, a close ally of the Dutertes. ADVERTISEMENT Vice President Duterte said her father's arrest was an affront to the country's sovereignty and described it as "state kidnapping." The Marcos administration rejected this allegation, saying the arrest was lawful because of an existing International Criminal Court warrant that was coursed through the International Criminal Police Organization or Interpol, of which the country is a member. Duterte insisted that the ICC lacked jurisdiction over the Philippines and the former president because of the withdrawal of the Philippines from the Rome Statute in 2019. The International Criminal Court took ex-President Duterte into custody Wednesday to face charges over his war on drugs. The ICC, based in The Hague, believes there are "reasonable grounds" to charge Duterte with murder as a crime against humanity, as an "indirect co-perpetrator" during the anti-drug campaign that rights groups estimate killed tens of thousands. ADVERTISEMENT "I am the one who led our law enforcement and military. I said that I will protect you and I will be responsible for all of this," Duterte said in a video posted to his and a close advisor's Facebook pages. "I have been telling the police, the military, that it was my job and I am responsible," said the 79-year-old, the first Asian former head of state to appear before the ICC. A spokesman confirmed Duterte was in court custody after he arrived in Rotterdam by private jet. A vehicle thought to be carrying Duterte drove into the ICC detention center in The Hague past a crowd of dozens of supporters, some shouting: "Bring him back" and waving national flags. Duterte will be held there until an initial court appearance, likely in the coming days.

ABS-CBN.article_headline: PhilHealth chief promises accountability amid call to overhaul board | ABS-CBN News
ABS-CBN.article_body: MANILA — The head of Philippine Health Insurance Corp. (PhilHealth) promised accountability in the state insurer's ranks in response to a Supreme Court magistrate who said an overhaul is needed in light of its budget issues. During the third day of oral arguments on Tuesday, March 4, regarding the controversial transfer of P89.9-billion in excess PhilHealth reserve funds to the national treasury, Supreme Court Associate Justice Antonio Kho Jr. said it may be time to revamp the PhilHealth board "for not complying with what the law requires" in requesting its budget from Congress. PhilHealth president and CEO Edwin Mercado, who assumed office last month noted the 'dedication' of the members of the board. "Nakikita ko naman po ang dedikasyon ng ating board members. Bagamat ganoon po eh lahat naman po kami dito maging ako man po ay ina-assess po regularly ang performance," Mercado said in a television interview Wednesday. ADVERTISEMENT (I can see the board members' dedication. Our performance is assessed regularly, even mine) He said the PhilHealth board under his leadership will be "metrics driven" and will have accountability. The transfer of supposedly excess funds has raised questions on why PhilHealth had them and did not use them to benefit members, and whether the money could legally be transferred for use for other government projects. The state insurer also said that PhilHealth will abide with "whatever the decision of the Supreme Court" on the P60-billion fund already transferred to the national treasury. Kho, in the same oral arguments, said PhilHealth must urge President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. to release an order reverting the transferred “excess funds” to PhilHealth to be used in expanding its benefit packages and improving services. ADVERTISEMENT "Kami ho ay naniniwala na patas po ang proseso, ito po ay pinakikinggan ng talaga pong mga mahistradong sanay po at bihasa dito sa ating mga batas. Kung ano po ang desisyon ng ating kataas-taasang hukuman, kami po ay mag-a-abide, kami po ay susunod," Mercado stated. (We believe that this is a fair process and magistrates who are experienced and are experts in the law are listeninh. We will abid by whatever the Supreme Court decides) The SC will hold its fourth round of oral arguments on April 29.

ABS-CBN.article_headline: PH Navy prepares for conversion of 2 Subic islands into military reservations | ABS-CBN News
ABS-CBN.article_body: MANILA — The Philippine Navy is preparing for the possible occupation of two islands in Subic Bay once these are declared as military reservations. Grande Island and Chiquita Island are located at the southern entrance of Subic Bay, which was once a United States military base until the Philippine Senate rejected a lease extension in 1991. The facility has since been transformed into a freeport zone. “The thrust right now of the Philippine Navy is to prepare for the eventual occupation or preparation of the land that will be awarded through a presidential proclamation declaring part of SBMA [Subic Bay Metropolitan Authority] and Grande Island and Chiquita Island as military reservations,” Rear Admiral Roy Vincent Trinidad, PN spokesperson for the West Philippine Sea, told reporters at Camp Aguinaldo in Quezon City on Tuesday. ADVERTISEMENT According to Trinidad, Grande Island and Chiquita Island need to be declared as military reservations due to their proximity to Subic Bay — its “natural layout” providing safe harbor for Navy ships using the waterway. There is also an existing runway in Subic Bay, which can be used by Philippine aircraft. “Hence, the need to be able to have a military presence, a foothold in the Subic area,” Trinidad said. But the official clarified that the move to turn the two islands into military reservations has nothing to do with the arrest of six foreign nationals and two Filipinos found conducting illegal activities on Grande Island on March 19. “The foreign nationals that were arrested on Grande Island were there even before the talks of having that as a naval reservation. Nauna sila doon bago lumabas yung news na gagawing naval reservation ang part of Subic Bay,” Trinidad noted. ADVERTISEMENT Authorities nabbed five Chinese, a Cambodian and two Filipinos on the island last week due to suspected espionage and kidnapping activities related to Philippine offshore gaming operators (POGOs). In a statement released on March 20, the Department of National Defense (DND) said converting Grande Island and Chiquita Island would enhance security for the Subic Special Economic and Freeport Zone, including the Riviera Wharf and the Subic Bay International Airport. It added that the planned conversion aligns with the "ongoing development of the naval operating base of the PN to strengthen and maintain our strategic presence along our western seaboard." Grande Island is a strategic vantage point with a clear view of key sea lanes in the West Philippine Sea, including Bajo de Masinloc or Scarborough Shoal.

ABS-CBN.article_headline: Transport group calls on commuters to join protest vs PUV modernization | ABS-CBN News
ABS-CBN.article_body: MANILA — Transport group Manibela on Tuesday called on passengers to join a protest against the PUV modernization program's franchise consolidation requirement, which they said could take thousands of traditional jeepneys off the roads by January. The PUV modernization program requires jeepney operators to consolidate individual franchises into a single franchise under a cooperative or corporation by December 31, 2023. Failure to do so could revoke their permits to operate, authorities earlier said. Manibela estimates that around 40,000 jeepneys have yet to comply with the requirement. "Malaki pa rin po ang kawalan nito na masasakyan ng ating mga kababayan," the group's leader, Mar Valbuena, told TeleRadyo Serbisyo. ADVERTISEMENT He said they have yet to receive any feedback from authorities on their bid to move the deadline, leaving drivers no other choice but to wait for the Supreme Court to act on their petition to block the franchise consolidation. "Hindi po kami nawawalan ng pag-asa… Maghihintay po tayo," he said of their petition. But if the Supreme Court rejects their petition, Valbuena said, "Wala po tayong magagawa doon kundi protesta talaga ang kailangan nating iparamdam, baka mas malaki pang protesta ang kailangan nating ipakita sa gobyerno." "Baka sakaling ang commuters, sumama na sa atin sa pagpoprotesta," he added. "Sana ang puso ng ating Pangulo ay haplusin nawa po ng ating Panginoon na magkaroon siya ng puso sa ating drivers, operators, lahat po ng maapektuhan nito. Domino effect po ang mangyayari dito," Valbuena said. ADVERTISEMENT "At sana kasama na ang Supreme Court… yung mga mahistrado po natin ay pumabor at makita na yung petition ng ating mga kasamahan ay talaga namang hindi handa ang ating gobyerno. Sana walang sapilitan at magpatuloy po ang aning hanapbuhay," he said. Another transport group, Piston, said it was studying whether it would continue plying roads after the Dec. 31 deadline. It is also considering bringing its protest to the gates of Malacañang. "Pinag-aaralan po natin at lagi naman po tayong bukas na posible talaga itong umabot sa kampohan sa labas ng Malakanyang," Piston president Mody Floranda said in a separate TeleRadyo Serbisyon interview. Jeepney drivers and operators have said "modern jeepneys" are too expensive and will deprive single-unit operators of route franchises that will then go to big corporations and to transport cooperatives. Some drivers and operators have argued that upgrading existing jeepneys will be a less expensive way to make them more fuel efficient and environment friendly. ADVERTISEMENT But the transport department said forming a cooperative would allow operators easier access to funds, especially when applying for loans for the modern jeepneys. The franchise consolidation deadline has been extended six times since 2020, noted Transport Undersecretary Timothy John Batan. He said 30 percent of in Metro Manila PUVs have complied with the required as of November. Authorities are still consolidating the latest figures for December, he said. Regulators will issue special permits for routes that might see fewer jeepneys in January if drivers fail to consolidate and their franchises are be revoked, added the official.

ABS-CBN.article_headline: Roque says won't force Dutertes to choose him as ICC lawyer | ABS-CBN News
ABS-CBN.article_body: Former Presidential spokesperson Atty. Harry Roque on Thursday said he will not force the Duterte family to select him as part of Rodrigo Duterte's legal team as the former president faces the International Criminal Court. The Dutertes have decided to stick with their decision to have British-Israeli lawyer Nicholas Kaufman as their lead counsel. Roque said he respects the Dutertes' decision. "Bahala po pumili ang President Duterte. Pero ako po ha, kung ayaw ni VP Sara at gusto ni VP sara na iba ang magrepresent mam that's your call," said the former presidential spokesperson in a Facebook video. ADVERTISEMENT Roque, one of the only five Filipino lawyers recognized by the ICC, said that even if the elder Duterte chooses him, he will still need the endorsement of his daughter, Vice President Sara Duterte. "Hindi ko naman ipagpipilitan ang sarili ko at kung ako irerequest ni PRRD, importante rin na iindorso ako at irequest din ako ni VP Sara... kasi talaga ako'y taga sunod ni VP Sara. At iyan po ay walang kaplastikan," he said. "Kita nyo nga sumunod ako sa Uniteam anong nangyari," he quipped, alluding to the ongoing political rift between President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. and the younger Duterte. "Kung gusto n'ya lahat dayuhan, I will bow to it at intindihin natin na hindi lang si PRRD ang magdedesisyon kundi si VP Sara din dahil siya naman ay abogada rin," he said. Kaufman is in the process of assembling a legal team composed of a co-counsel, legal assistant, investigator and a case manager. ADVERTISEMENT Roque, together with former executive secretary Salvador Medialdea were initially part of Duterte's legal team in the ICC. But the Vice President said they needed somebody who has experience on the ground, hence their decision to choose Kaufman. "Unang-una, his team is headed by Atty. Nicholas Kaufman, and then … meron pa akong mga kakausapin na mga lawyers 'no. Meron pang darating na isang abugado, i-interview ko siya para sumali sa team. And then, once maayos na yung team for ICC, magwi-withdraw si Atty. Medialdea kasi meron lang limited na mga slots for lawyers, and we want all the lawyers on board na merong ICC experience," said Duterte earlier week. Roque is facing an arrest order for skipping a House inquiry into Philippine offshore gaming operators. He said Monday he would apply for asylum in the Netherlands. Roque has also been implicated in the POGO controversy for accompanying and helping Cassandra Li Ong, an official of Whirlwind and Lucky South 99 gaming firm, to pay off arrears totaling USD500,000. ADVERTISEMENT Palace Press Officer and Undersecretary Claire Castro said Roque must prove that his allegations of political persecution are well founded before he is granted asylum. She noted that evidence showing Roque’s links to POGOs “just fell into the hands of the Presidential Anti-Organized Crime Commission” during its investigation into POGO operations. “Lahat ng ebidensya na nagpapakita diumano na siya ay involved sa POGO ay lumagpak lang sa kamay ng PAOCC. Nung sila ay nag imbestiga sa Lucky South 99, dun lang nakita ‘yung dokumento at lumabas ang pangalang Harry Roque,” she said. Lucky South 99, located in Porac, Pampanga, was raided by Philippine law enforcers last year due to suspected criminal activities such as human trafficking and torture.

ABS-CBN.article_headline: TV PATROL: Sia inakusahan ang kampo ni Vico Sotto na pinulitika ang kanyang ‘solo parent joke’ | ABS-CBN News
ABS-CBN.article_body: Pamumulitika - 'yan ang nakikitang dahilan ng isang kandidato sa Pasig City kung bakit naging 'national issue' ang biro niya tungkol sa mga solo parent. Ipinagkibit-balikat naman ni Mayor Vico Sotto ang pahayag. Nagpapatrol, Katrina Domingo. TV Patrol, Sabado, 5 Abril 2025 KUALA LUMPUR — President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. stood firm that filing cases against those involved in the flood control fiasco cannot be done in haste, stressing that due process should be observed. This was in response to some business and labor groups who criticized him over supposed “slow” actions vs corruption into the flood control scandal. He said that he constantly gets messages telling him to order people allegedly involved arrested. “‘Alam naman natin kung sino sila, ikulong mo na.’ ‘Kunin mo lahat ang pera nila.’ ‘Ipagbenta mo na ‘yung mga bahay nila, ibalik sa ano…” ('We know who they are, just jail them'. 'Take all their money'. 'Sell their houses...') What would then I be accused of if we did that?’ Marcos Jr. said in a press briefing following the closing ceremony of the 47th ASEAN Summit and Related Summits Tuesday, October 28. ADVERTISEMENT Business groups noted over the weekend that months since Marcos Jr. called out flood control anomalies in his State of the Nation Address, they were “told to be content with immigration lookout bulletins for now” instead of hold-departure orders that are issued by courts. The chief executive argued that cases should be backed up by solid evidence to assure conviction. He said that people who have stolen billions from the government may end up being set free if weak cases are filed against them. “That would be much worse result. So, due process must be observed,” Marcos Jr. asked. “We must make sure na alam – alam naman talaga natin kung sino sila. Kaya tiyakin natin na makukulong talaga sila at ang kanilang mga ninakaw ay ibalik sa gobyerno, ibalik sa tao,” he added. ADVERTISEMENT (We must make sure — we really do know who they are. So let us make sure that they are convicted and what they stole will be returned to the government, to the people) He said the government only gets “one chance at this" and that government cannot waste the opportunity to bring corrupt officials and contractors to account. “So, do you want to get it done quickly or do you want to get it done right? That's the choice that we have,” he added.

ABS-CBN.article_headline: US defense chief Hegseth reaffirms 'ironclad commitment' to Philippines | ABS-CBN News
ABS-CBN.article_body: MANILA — The United States reaffirmed its "ironclad commitment" to the Mutual Defense Treaty with the Philippines during the landmark visit of US Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth to Manila on Friday. Hegseth met with President Ferdinand Marcos, Jr. in Malacañang where he emphasized that the Trump administration is committed to the country’s alliance and partnership with the Philippines. “I had a chance to speak just a few minutes ago to our president, President [Donald] Trump, who sends his regards to you as well, thinks very fondly of this great country, is very committed to the alliance that we have, to the friendship that we have, the cooperation that we have,” Hegseth said. “And he and I both want to express the ironclad commitment we have to the mutual defense treaty and to the partnership, economically, militarily, which our staffs have worked on diligently for weeks and weeks and months,” he continued. ADVERTISEMENT “There is a very real reason why our first trip and our first visit is here to visit you in your great country.” The US Defense chief expressed the United States’ interest in further expanding military cooperation with the Philippines, which he says is critically important amid "threats" posed by China in the Indo-Pacific region. He also noted the importance of deterrence and for allies to stand “shoulder-to-shoulder” to ensure peace and freedom of navigation in the South China Sea. “Peace through strength is a very real thing. Deterrence is necessary around the world, but specifically in this region, in your country, considering the threats from the Communist Chinese and that friends need to stand shoulder-to-shoulder to deter conflict, to ensure that there's free navigation,” Hegseth said. Marcos meanwhile emphasized the Philippines’ longstanding alliance with the United States, as well as the critical role of the US in ensuring peace in the Indo-Pacific region as he welcomed Hegseth to Manila. ADVERTISEMENT “Your visit to the region, and especially the fact that you have come to the Philippines as your first stop, is a very strong indication and sends a very strong message of the commitment of both our countries to continue to work together, to maintain the peace in the Indo-Pacific Region within the South China Sea,” the President said. Malacañang Press Officer Claire Castro meanwhile welcomed the US Defense chief’s reaffirmation of the US commitment to its mutual defense treaty with the Philippines. “Opo, magandang-magandang balita po iyan para sa ating bansa. Katunayan nga po ay nagkaroon po ng reaffirmation ng US commitment to uphold our Mutual Defense Treaty,” Castro said. (Yes, that is good news for the country. Proof of that is the reaffirmation of US commitment to our Mutual Defense Treaty)

ABS-CBN.article_headline: NBI: 4 caught in raid on Bulacan rice warehouse undergo inquest proceedings | ABS-CBN News
ABS-CBN.article_body: MANILA — Four respondents have faced inquest proceedings at the Department of Justice in connection by the National Bureau of Investigation and the Department of Agriculture on a warehouse in Bocaue, Bulacan on Monday. In a text message to NBI reporters, NBI Director Jaime Santiago confirmed that the four individuals were the ones arrested during the raid on a warehouse where rice was being hoarded illegally. Inquest proceedings are summary investigations conducted by a public prosecutor to determine whether there is probable cause to further detain a person arrested without a warrant and whether an information or formal case should be filed against them in court. NBI Director Jaime Santiago said Tuesday that rice at the warehouse had been mixed with different varieties of rice and then repacked to be sold at a higher price. ADVERTISEMENT Authorities arrested the warehouse manager, two cashiers and an inventory officer in the raid. The NBI said the four refused to name the owner of the warehouse. The NBI said they would file complaints of hoarding, adulteration, profiteering, untruthful labeling, and economic sabotage against the four.

ABS-CBN.article_headline: Duque says statement during House probe 'taken out of context' | ABS-CBN News
ABS-CBN.article_body: MANILA — Former Health Secretary Francisco Duque III on Tuesday explained his statement during Monday's House hearing, where he said that former President Rodrigo Duterte authorized the transfer of P47.6 billion worth of COVID-19 funds to the Procurement Service of the Department of Budget and Management (PS-DBM). According to Duque, his remark "has regrettably been taken out of context." Duque insisted that the transfer of funds for the procurement of common-use supplies and equipment (CSEs) such as face masks, face shields, and PPEs was above-board given the urgency and novelty of the situation. "What has been lost in the political noise is the fact that these CSEs were procured sometime in April 2020, during the very beginning of the pandemic... Their procurement was not only necessary, but was of extreme urgency," Duque said. ADVERTISEMENT The Ombudsman in May said that the medical supplies were not CSEs, a term that usually refers to office supplies. "Indeed, the directive of President Duterte was consistent with and pursuant to the national policy embodied in the Bayanihan to Heal as One Act 1 and 2," he added. Duque also said that Duterte's authorization for the transfer was not new as it was well-documented in his public pronouncements. "President Duterte has been consistent and open in directing his administration, as a whole, to act swiftly and decisively and do all that it can to fight the pandemic... His directives were openly made and repeated during our numerous cabinet meetings, his regular televised public address, and in various interviews reported by news outlets," Duque explained. The purchase of the COVID-19 supplies was allegedly marred by corruption, with Pharmally accused of being a preferred contractor. ADVERTISEMENT Former Senate President Franklin Drilon earlier said that Duque's statement during the hearing was a "change of tune". Sen. Risa Hontiveros said Duterte should explain why he ordered the transfer of funds. Government officials, including Duterte, had defended the transaction, saying there was a need to fast-track procurement because of the COVID-19 emergency and that the controversial firm had delivered on the contracts.

ABS-CBN.article_headline: Palace defends Cabinet officials who skipped probe into Duterte ICC arrest | ABS-CBN News
ABS-CBN.article_body: MANILA — Malacañang on Thursday defended its decision to bar Cabinet officials from attending the investigation of the Senate Committee on Foreign Relations into the recent arrest and transfer of former President Rodrigo Duterte to ICC custody. In an interview, Executive Secretary Lucas Bersamin said the Palace believes most of the topics that would likely be discussed in the second Senate probe, headed by Sen. Imee Marcos, would come under executive privilege. “When we learned about the topics, kasi yung invitation ni Sen. Imee was quite specific about the topics. So we had a look at this invitation and we determined that there were many probable or likely topics na covered by those matters that could come under yung executive privilege,” Bersamin said. Senator Ronald “Bato” Dela Rosa had urged the Senate to subpoena the Cabinet officials following their absence in the Senate investigation Thursday. ADVERTISEMENT President Ferdinand Marcos, Jr., the brother of the senator who initiated the probe, had said that the Philippines' commitment to Interpol was the basis for arresting Duterte, which was the subject of an arrest warrant issued by the International Criminal Court (ICC). The camp of Duterte however said that the arrest was unlawful, calling it "state kidnapping."

ABS-CBN.article_headline: Lalaki arestado matapos i-hostage ang kapatid sa Tondo, Manila | ABS-CBN News
ABS-CBN.article_body: Nauwi sa pangho-hostage ang pagtatalo ng dalawang magkapatid sa Tondo, Maynila. Nagpapatrol, Francis Orcio. TV Patrol, Miyerkules, 19 Marso 2025. MANILA — Department of Public Works and Highways (DPWH) Secretary Vince Dizon on Wednesday formed a new technical working group (TWG) tasked to assess each flood control project before they are given funding and carried out in 2027. The panel, which met with Dizon at the DPWH, includes Department of Environment and Natural Resources (DENR) Undersecretary Carlos Primo David, who also heads the Water Resources Management Office, flood control systems expert Guillermo Tabios III, and Project NOAH (Nationwide Operational Assessment of Hazards) Executive Director Mahar Lagmay. “I’m asking this group to vet the plans. Walang papasok, under my watch, na (locally-funded) flood control project na hindi sasabihin ng group of experts na ‘to na, tama yan, okay yan, dapat gawin yan,” said Dizon. Dizon said this is to avoid a repeat of one of the more common problems he uncovered during his many onsite inspections since assuming office last month: the lack of any engineering plans. ADVERTISEMENT He believes this is one of the main reasons why flooding remains severe across many parts of the country, despite the government pouring billions into flood control. This also led President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. to order a temporary suspension of all locally funded flood control projects for 2026 until the DPWH addresses corruption and inefficiency within its ranks. “Marami tayong mga nakitang flood control, talagang hindi pinagplanuhan at pinag-isipan… Ginawa lang ‘tong mga flood control na ‘to, to be quite frank, para pagkakitaan ng pera. So yun ang kailangan magbago,” said Dizon. For 2027, Dizon wants the TWG’s help in planning the DPWH’s 2027 budget. “They will come up with an initial plan. Kasi right now we are still awaiting the 18 Major River System Master Plan that will be done by our international partner agencies like the World Bank, ADB (Asian Development Bank), and JICA (Japan International Cooperation Agency). Next year yan (lalabas), pero too late na yun kasi kailangan na nating magplano para sa 2027 budget starting now,” he said. ADVERTISEMENT Lagmay said by following a science-based approach, the DPWH’s flood control programs would become more effective, cost-efficient, and holistic. “Ang mga baha naman, hindi naman yan tumitigil sa administrative boundary ng munisipyo o city. So dapat yung assessment natin, pag-aaral natin coming from the mountains to the sea… Coordinated lahat— national pati local government units,” he said. The group will also recommend which existing flood control structures should be demolished if they are found to worsen flooding instead of preventing it. Engineer Tabios said he already presented some possible examples. “I’ve done some (studies) here in Metro Manila like Caloocan… By creating those coastal roadways, tapos hindi adequate yung drainage coming from inland, you create flooding inland. Hindi makalabas sa sea. That’s what happens if you don’t properly vet, evaluate the performance of whatever infrastructure na gagawin mo,” he said.

department of environment and natural resources

ABS-CBN.article_headline: MRT-7 to start partial operations by end of 2025 | ABS-CBN News
ABS-CBN.article_body: MANILA (UPDATED) -- The MRT Line 7 will be partly operational by the fourth quarter of 2025, a Department of Transportation (DOTr) official said Tuesday. Transportation Assistant Secretary for Railways Jorjette Aquino said the MRT-7's Quezon City portion, which consists of 12 stations, will be up and running towards the end of next year. Meanwhile, the Tala Station in Caloocan City will be completed by 2026. Aquino said they hope the construction of the 14th station in San Jose del Monte in Bulacan can be finished by 2027 once alignment issues are resolved. ADVERTISEMENT The city government of San Jose Del Monte earlier proposed 3 alternative route alignments for the project. In a statement, Mayor Arthur Robes said the current plan had current and future traffic implications, and would affect the quality of living, as well as disrupt the delivery of essential services, among others. Aquino said the DOTr, together with the private sector proponent San Miguel Corporation, will conduct a joint site inspection of these proposed realignments this June. "After that inspection, inaasahan namin na ang San Miguel ang magkakaroon ng ridership study sa bawat option at bawat alignment para mai-presenta nila sa DOTr at makipagbigay sila ng recommendation nila kung ano sa tingin nila yung magiging mas beneficial sa mga pasahero," she said. (After that inspection, we expect San Miguel to come up with a ridership study for each option and each alignment that they can present to the DOTr along with a recommendation of what they see as the most beneficial (route) for passengers.) ADVERTISEMENT Aquino noted that one of their main considerations is accessibility. "Siyempre tinitignan natin yung convenience ng pasahero. Malapit ba ito sa mga transport terminals? Para mas madaling mapuntahan," she said. (Of course, we’re looking at what will be convenient for passengers. Will it be near other transport terminals? So that it will be easily accessible.) Aquino added that should there be adjustments to the location of the station, it would not be too far off from the original plan. "Hindi naman siguro totally maiiba, still within the area. Yung exact location lang e siguro magkakaroon ng displacement ng 100 meters," said Aquino. ADVERTISEMENT (It probably will not be totally changed, it will still be within the area. But as to the exact location, there may have to be a displacement of about 100 meters.) "Kung makapag-decide tayo for the location of San Jose Del Monte, hopefully by 2027, makakapag-operate yung Station 14," she added. (If we can decide on the location in San Jose Del Monte, hopefully by 2027, we can start operations for Station 14.) The construction of the 22-kilometer rail is 69.86 percent done as of May 2024. Once completed, it is expected to reduce travel time from Quezon City to San Jose Del Monte to just 35 minutes.

ABS-CBN.article_headline: Senado, Kamara pinagkokomento ng SC sa petisyon vs Sara Duterte impeachment trial | ABS-CBN News
ABS-CBN.article_body: Tinalakay sa en banc session sa Korte Suprema ang petisyon ni Vice President Sara Duterte para pigilan ang kanyang impeachment trial sa Senado. Nagpapatrol, Adrian Ayalin. TV Patrol, Martes, 25 Pebrero 2025. MANILA— The Department of the Interior and Local Government (DILG) is urging all local government units (LGUs) across the country to conduct comprehensive infrastructure audits on both public and private buildings to help communities prepare for the threat of strong earthquakes. In a statement, the DILG said assessing the structural integrity of buildings is vital to ensure public safety and to lessen the risk of casualties and property damage during major seismic events. Aside from inspecting key public facilities such as hospitals, schools, government offices, and emergency response centers, the agency also wants privately owned structures to be covered by the audits. “With the increasing frequency and intensity of earthquakes, proactive preparedness is our best defense... Through harmonized audits, stronger partnerships, and evidence-based planning, we can build safer, more resilient communities across the country,” the DILG said. ADVERTISEMENT The DILG in 2024 partnered with various government agencies and professional groups, including the Association of Structural Engineers of the Philippines and the Philippine Institute of Civil Engineers, to develop the Harmonized Infrastructure Audit Tool (HIAT). The HIAT serves as a standardized framework for evaluating building resilience and identifying potential vulnerabilities before disasters strike. According to the DILG, 18 high-risk LGUs in Metro Manila, CALABARZON, and Central Luzon, areas traversed by the West Valley Fault, have already been trained to carry out infrastructure audits. Another 12 LGUs in the National Capital Region and 20 in Cavite, located outside the fault corridor, have also completed the training, while 10 more LGUs in Central Luzon are expected to follow suit by the end of the month. As part of the nationwide rollout, the department has also built a corps of trained coaches composed of technical experts from professional organizations, academic institutions, and local governments representing 74 LGUs nationwide. ADVERTISEMENT These coaches will mentor local audit teams and guide them in using the HIAT effectively. The DILG is also encouraging private sector participation through the establishment of Local Infrastructure Learning Hubs in its regional offices. These hubs will serve as centers of collaboration among LGUs, engineers, and schools to support audit teams led by local chief executives and composed of building officials and disaster management officers. “By institutionalizing innovative safety mechanisms and strengthening intersectoral collaboration, the DILG reaffirms its commitment to building disaster-ready localities and ensuring a safer infrastructure sector for all Filipinos.”

ABS-CBN.article_headline: Orihinal na imahen ng Sto. Niño de Tondo ipinrusisyon sa Maynila | ABS-CBN News
ABS-CBN.article_body: Libo-libong deboto ang nakiisa sa prusisyon ng Sto. Niño De Tondo ngayong kapistahan ng batang Hesus. Bukod sa mga replica ng imahen ng Señor Sto. Niño, bitbit din ng mga dumalo ang kani-kanilang panalangin at pasasalamat. Nagpa-Patrol, Jessie Cruzat. TV Patrol, Linggo, 19 Enero 2025 GYEONGJU, South Korea — President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. and Chinese President Xi Jinping on Friday joined other world leaders in the 32nd Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) Leaders’ Summit, where host country South Korea called for “harmony and coexistence” despite differences in national interests. South Korean President Lee Jae Myung in his opening remarks urged APEC members to “become connected and be more open” to one another so that the region — which registered 48 percent of global trade — “can go down the path of prosperity.” “Our reality does not leave much room for rosy forecasts. We are all at an infliction point of rapid changes in international order,” said Lee, whose country is hosting the annual regional meeting this year. “Free trade is facing wild changes. Uncertainties are growing for the global economy and trade and investment is losing its vitality,” he said during the APEC Economic Leaders’ Meeting Informal Dialogue with Guests. ADVERTISEMENT “Cooperation and solidarity is the only answer that will lead all of us to a better tomorrow. We cannot always be on the same page as each member economy may have their own interests, yet we cannot always unite with the ultimate goal of gathering strength for co-prosperity.” Lee’s opening statement comes as Manila and Beijing’s relations continue to be marred by China’s incursions in the Philippines’ exclusive economic zone despite a 2016 arbitral ruling that invalidated its sweeping 9-dash line claim in the South China Sea. This year’s APEC also marks the first time that Marcos Jr. and Xi would meet in person since January 2023, when the Filipino leader traveled to Beijing for a state visit in an attempt to amicably settle disputes in the strategic waterway where trillions-worth of goods pass through annually. The Summit is being held in Gyeongju — South Korea’s ancient capital — where consensus building has been honored for centuries, Lee said. “Our reality does not leave much room for rosy forecasts. We are all at an infliction point of rapid changes in international order,” Lee said, noting that “free trade is facing wild changes” while “uncertainties are growing for the global economy, and trade and investment is losing its vitality.” ADVERTISEMENT “[But] The Hwabaek spirit does not enforce any single idea but rather strive to achieve a harmony of different voices, exploring the path for harmony and coexistence,” he said. “The more we become connected and the more open we become to one another, the further we can go down the path of prosperity.” The Department of Foreign Affairs earlier said that Marcos Jr. is not expected to have a bilateral meeting with Xi on the sidelines of the APEC 2025, saying that this forum traditionally focuses on economic and trade issues, instead of security and defense. On October 30, Marcos Jr. told Filipinos here that he would focus on wooing investors from APEC economies to help boost the Philippines’ tech industry as the world further shifts to digitalization and artificial intelligence. Marcos Jr. has described the APEC as a “very important” meeting, underscoring that the regional bloc represents over 80 percent of the Philippines’ trade.

ABS-CBN.article_headline: Sen. Dela Rosa inaming posible siyang magtago sakaling ipaaresto ng ICC. | ABS-CBN News
ABS-CBN.article_body: Inamin ni Sen. Ronald Dela Rosa na posible siyang magtago sakaling ipaaresto ng International Criminal Court. Tila binawi rin ng senador ang minsang sinabi na handa siyang alagaan si dating Pangulong Rodrigo Duterte sa kulungan sa The Netherlands. Nagpapatrol RG Cruz. TV Patrol, Miyerkules, 19 Marso 2025. ABS-CBN.article_headline: China's bomber deployment in West PH Sea 'expected' amid Hegseth's visit – analyst | ABS-CBN News
ABS-CBN.article_body: MANILA – The reported deployment of China's bombers in Bajo de Masinloc (Scarborough Shoal) in the West Philippine Sea is "expected" amid the visit of US Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth to the Philippines, analysts said on Saturday. Based on a Reuters report on Friday, satellite images showed Beijing deployed two long-range H-6 bombers around Bajo de Masinloc – which came ahead of Hegseth's visit. Geopolitical analyst Don McLain Gill said this just showed "China is not happy." "It is frustrated with the fact that the Philippines is stepping up in ensuring that it has the capacity to defend its sovereignty and sovereign rights and working with countries who also share the same goals and objectives," said Gill in a chance interview with reporters. ADVERTISEMENT "Definitely, being an expansionist power, China will not take this happily, therefore it is a show of frustration," he added. Prof. Renato de Castro, an international relations expert, said Beijing's reaction is expected and is only for optics. "Very strong talaga yung nangyari, yung joint statement ng DND tsaka ng US department na mag-deploy ng missile," said De Castro in a Saturday news forum. "The Chinese are expected to react, they have to cater to their population. Ipapakita nila na tine-threaten tayo so we have to do certain actions, like sending two bombers sa panatag shpoal and expect a live fire exercise. Kumbaga pinapakita ng Tsina na 'hindi kami papasindak sa inyo,'" he added. The Philippines, he said, is entitled to strengthen its defense system. ADVERTISEMENT ABS-CBN News reached out to the Armed Forces of the Philippines (AFP) to confirm the presence of China's bombers in the West Philippine Sea but its spokesperson has yet to respond. On Friday, the US and the Philippines agreed that one of the key initiatives to accelerate its longstanding defense partnership is the deployment of more advanced US military capabilities in the Philippines. This includes the Navy-Marine Expeditionary Ship Interdiction System (NMESIS)—a mobile, ground-based anti-ship missile launcher—and highly capable unmanned surface vessels. The training and testing of NMESIS will also be integrated into the upcoming Balikatan exercises, the annual joint military drills between Philippine and US forces. Hegseth told President Ferdinand Marcos, Jr. on Friday, that the two countries must stand "shoulder to shoulder" in the face of the threat represented by China.

ABS-CBN.article_headline: 3 patay sa sunog sa Malinta, Valenzuela City | ABS-CBN News
ABS-CBN.article_body: Tatlo ang patay, kabilang ang mag-ama, sa sunog na tumupok sa mahigit dalawampung bahay sa Valenzuela City. Nagpapatrol, Job Manahan. ABS-CBN.article_headline: Imee Marcos says leaving Alyansa over differences on Duterte arrest | ABS-CBN News
ABS-CBN.article_body: MANILA — Sen. Imee Marcos has withdrawn from the Alyansa Para sa Bagong Pilipinas endorsed by her brother President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. citing differences over the arrest of former President Rodrigo Duterte. Sen. Marcos last week held a Senate hearing on Duterte's arrest and transfer to the International Criminal Court in the Netherlands. She said she will present her preliminary findings soon but said the government's actions "run counter to my ideals and principles." She added: "Thus, I cannot stand on the same campaign platform as the rest of the Alyansa." ADVERTISEMENT Sen. Marcos had earlier on declined inclusion in the slate, saying she wanted to be able to talk to both factions in the former UniTeam alliance. President Marcos said his sister was welcome on the slate and that the administration would support her reelection campaign. He did not mention Sen. Marcos at a campaign sortie on March 21 when he batted for the members of the administration ticket. "As I have stated from the outset of the election period, I will continue to maintain my independence," Sen. Marcos said Wednesday. In the same statement, she said government resource speakers' answers — and lack of them when they invoked executive privilege and the sub judice rule — "only gave rise to ever greater suspicion that the Constitution may have been disregarded and our sovereignty diminished by the arrest of former President Rodrigo Roa Duterte." Alyansa campaign manager Navotas Rep. Toby Tiangco said, "We respect Senator Imee’s decision." "We wish her luck in the campaign," he added.

ABS-CBN.article_headline: Marcos Jr. joins Catholics in praying for recovery of ailing Pope Francis | ABS-CBN News

But the Vatican has reportedly begun preparations to elect a new Pope. -ANC, The World Tonight, February 24, 2025 MANILA — Flood-control corruption whistleblower is not under the protection of the Philippine Marine Corps, the Philippine Navy said Thursday after former Anakaslusugan Rep. Mike Defensor that he is. The Marines are the Navy's infantry force and are under its command. In a statement, Capt. Marissa Martinez, Navy spokesperson, said Guteza retired from the corps in June 2020 and "no longer falls under the administrative authority of the Philippine Navy." She said that "any engagements or interactions he may have at present are undertaken in his personal capacity." ADVERTISEMENT Martinez stressed that Guteza is not under the protection of the Philippine Marine Corps and that the Navy has "no involvement in his personal affairs." She added the Navy is "a professional and non-partisan organization" that is focused on national defense. The Navy’s statement came after Defensor claimed that Guteza — recently identified as a “surprise whistleblower” in Senate investigations — was in the custody or protection of the Marines. Defensor, who gave no evidence of his claim, said Guteza had sought safety among “fellow ex-Marines” following the controversy surrounding his testimony. Guteza, a retired Marine and former security consultant, surfaced in September before the Senate Blue Ribbon Committee. ADVERTISEMENT In his affidavit and testimony, he alleged that he personally delivered cash-filled suitcases to the homes of then House Speaker Martin Romualdez and then Ako Bicol party-list Rep. Zaldy Co in connection with alleged irregularities in flood-control projects. Defensor said Guteza has declined to enter the government’s witness protection program. However, questions have since emerged over the authenticity of Guteza’s sworn affidavit. A Manila Regional Trial Court found that the lawyer whose signature appeared on the document denied notarizing it. Senate officials have said the issue of notarization could affect the affidavit’s validity but not necessarily invalidate Guteza’s oral testimony before the committee. ADVERTISEMENT As for reports of an alleged ambush involving Guteza, Captain Martinez said the Navy has no information about such an incident. She added that the matter should be referred to the Philippine National Police for proper investigation.

ABS-CBN.article_body: Nauwi sa saksakan ang sinasabing matagal nang alitan ng dalawang magkapitbahay sa Quezon City. Yan ang CCTV Patrol ni Lyza Aquino. TV Patrol, Miyerkules, 4 Disyembre 2024. MANILA — The police Highway Patrol Group on Friday inspected major bus terminals in San Juan and Quezon City to check for compliance with road safety guiedlines as thousands of passengers travel for Undas. Police Col. Hansel Marantan, HPG chief, said the terminals and the buses there "satisfied the substantial compliance” after inspection for cleanliness, license plates, and tire condition. Tires “should not be more than four or five years old, otherwise it becomes brittle and can cause accidents,” he added. He added that apart from minor violations, most terminals have shown full compliance with safety standards. “So far, everything is within expectations,” he concluded. ADVERTISEMENT The HPG has deployed around 400 personnel, including secret marshals and uniformed officers, to monitor the All Saints' and All Souls' holiday rush. “So far, we have not seen any major violations except for a few drivers who tested positive for prohibited drugs,” Marantan said. He emphasized bus drivers must exercise “extra diligence” since they are carrying dozens of passengers who depend on them for a safe trip. “If you are not in your normal state while driving, you might cause an accident,” he said. The Philippine National Police, Land Transportation Office, Metropolitan Manila Development Authority and Coast Guard have been conducting random drug tests and surprise inspections in recent days, which, Marantan said, has prompted higher compliance with safety rules. “It’s a good measure. They call it Oplan Harambe, and it’s being implemented not only in Metro Manila but also in the regions,” he said. The HPG is also working with the Department of Transportation to crack down on colorum, or unlicensed, transport.
